categories.name: Retail
categories.definition: The CBDC is available to the general public for all transactions.

categories.name: Wholesale
categories.definition: The CBDC is used by financial institutions for bank-to-bank payment transactions and settlements.

architecture.name: Architecture
architecture.title: The legal structure of claims.
architecture.chart_note: The bar chart below is calculated only for retail CBDCs.

categories.name: Direct CBDC
categories.definition: The CBDC is a direct claim on the central bank, meaning banks and the general public can deposit their money and make payments directly with the central bank.

categories.name: Hybrid CBDCC
categories.definition: This is an intermediate solution where the CBDC is a direct claim on the central bank but payments and real-time transactions are facilitated by financial intermediaries such as private banks.

categories.name: Synthetic CBDCC
categories.definition: The CBDC is not a direct claim on the central bank, claims are held by private financial institutions.

access.name: Access
access.title: An account-based system or digital tokens determines how users are represented and make transactions in the payments system. The classic example of a token-based system is cash, and an example of an account-based system is bank deposits.
access.chart_note: The bar chart below is calculated only for retail CBDCs.

infrastructure.name: Infrastructure
infrastructure.title: The infrastructure could be based on a conventional centrally controlled database, or on a distributed ledger technology (DLT). Conventional and DLT-based infrastructures often store data multiple times and in physically separate locations. The main difference between them lies in how the transactions are verified and secured.

categories.name: Research
categories.definition: Established working groups to explore the use cases, impact, and feasibility of a CBDC.

categories.name: Development
categories.definition: Initiated technical build and early testing of a CBDC in controlled environments.

categories.name: Pilot
categories.definition: Initiated small-scale testing of a CBDC in real world with a limited number of participants.

categories.name: Launched
categories.definition: Issued a CBDC for widespread retail and/or wholesale use.

categories.name: Other
categories.definition: No formal CBDC research but ongoing development of digital wallets and new payments infrastructure.
